Metadata: The role of micronutrients in the biosynthesis of the crustacean exoskeleton
"Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Aquaculture Nutrition: Biochemical and Physiological Approaches to Shellfish Nutrition," pp. 145-165, Lewes, Delaware, October 27-29, 1981.

Exoskeleton biosynthesis is reviewed from the standpoint of identifying possible nutrient demands of this process in crustaceans; specifically examined are the possible roles of selected micronutrients-​-​vitamins C, A, D, E, and K.
